columns.name: Timestamp
columns.description: Date and time when the event was recorded

columns.name: ActionType
columns.description: Type of disruption action taken, for example: ContainedUserLogonBlocked, ContainedUserSmbFileOpenBlocked, SafeBootGuardApplied

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device that reported the event; the reporting device can be the one that blocked the access, the compromised device itself, or even a different device that is aware of the attack

columns.name: SourceDeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device that the attack originated from

columns.name: TargetDeviceId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the device that was targeted or attacked

columns.name: TargetDeviceName
columns.description: Name of the device that was targeted or attacked

columns.name: TargetDomainName
columns.description: Domain name of the device that was targeted or attacked

columns.name: DeviceName
columns.description: Name of the device that reported the event; the reporting device can be the one that blocked the access, the compromised device itself, or even a different device that is aware of the attack

columns.name: DomainName
columns.description: Domain name that the device that reported the event is joined to; the reporting device can be the one that blocked the access, the compromised device itself, or even a different device that is aware of the attack

columns.name: InitiatingProcessId
columns.description: Process ID (PID) of the process that triggered that block action, based on the perspective of the reporting device

columns.name: InitiatingProcessFileName
columns.description: Name of the process that triggered the block action, based on the perspective of the reporting device

columns.name: SourceUserSid
columns.description: The security identifier of the account conducting the malicious activity

columns.name: SourceUserName
columns.description: The user name of the account conducting the malicious activity

columns.name: SourceUserDomainName
columns.description: The domain name of the account conducting the malicious activity

columns.name: SourceIPAddress
columns.description: IP address where the attacker communication originated from and was blocked by automatic attack disruption

columns.name: SourcePort
columns.description: Port where the attacker communication originated from

columns.name: IPAddress
columns.description: IP address that the attacker attempted to access

columns.name: Port
columns.description: Port that the attacker attempted to access

columns.name: SourceDeviceName
columns.description: Host name of the device where the attack originated from

columns.name: SourceDomainName
columns.description: Domain name of the device where the attack originated from

columns.name: AuthenticationProtocol
columns.description: Authentication protocol that the compromised user used to sign in; possible values: Undefined, NTLM, Kerberos

columns.name: Service
columns.description: Name of the service the attacker attempted to use, if the attacker signed in using Kerberos or NTLM; for example: SMB, HTTP, cifs, SMB, host, ldap, SMB, krbtgt

columns.name: InterfaceUuidSourceDomainName
columns.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) interface that the attacker attempted to access

columns.name: InterfaceFriendlyName
columns.description: Friendly name of the interface represented by the interface UUID

columns.name: FileName
columns.description: Name of the file that the attacker attempted to access

columns.name: ShareName
columns.description: Name of the share location that the attacker attempted to access

columns.name: LogonType
columns.description: Type of logon session the user attempted; possible values: interactive, remote interactive (RDP), network, batch job, service

columns.name: LogonId
columns.description: Identifier for a logon session; this is unique on the same device only between restarts

columns.name: SessionId
columns.description: Unique number assigned to a user by a website's server for the duration of the visit or session

columns.name: CompromisedAccountCount
columns.description: Number of compromised accounts that are part of the policy

columns.name: PolicyId
columns.description: Unique identifier for the policy

columns.name: PolicyName
columns.description: Name of the policy

columns.name: PolicyVersion
columns.description: Version of the policy

columns.name: PolicyHash
columns.description: Unique hash of the policy

columns.name: DataSources
columns.description: Products or services that provided information for the event; for example: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint

columns.name: IsPolicyOn
columns.description: Indicates the current state of the policy on the device at the time of the disruption event; possible values: true (the policy is on, therefore it was applied or enforced), false (the policy was turned off or revoked from the device)

columns.name: ReportType
columns.description: The nature and impact level of the reported event; possible values: Prevented (the action, such as a connection or authentication attempt, was fully blocked before execution), Blocked (an active connection or session was forcibly terminated, with partial impact on the device), PolicyUpdated (the client received and possibly applied a new policy)
